message_1: A certain survey reported that 45% of the students in a particular school play soccer, 35% play basketball, and 20% play both soccer and basketball. What percentage of students in the school do not play either soccer or basketball?
message_2:
To find the percentage of students who do not play either soccer or basketball, we can use the principle of inclusion-exclusion.

The percentage of students who play soccer or basketball is the sum of the percentage of students who play each sport minus the percentage of students who play both sports:

(Soccer) + (Basketball) - (Both) = 45% + 35% - 20% = 60%

Since the total percentage of students is 100%, the percentage of students who do not play either soccer or basketball is:

100% - 60% = 40%

So, 40% of the students in the school do not play either soccer or basketball.
